The percentage of urine excretion (formula ( 1)), diuretic action (formula ( 2)), and diuretic index (formula ( 3)) was calculated for all groups using the mean urine output at 6th and 24th hr. The obtained diuretic index was considered good if the resulted values were >1.5, moderate if the resulted values depict between 1.00 and 1.5, least if the resulted values range between 0.72 and 0.99, and nil if the resulted values < 0.72 [ 19, 23].
(1)
Urinary excretion =
Total urinary output
Total volume of liquid administered
∗ 100 ,
(2)
Diuretic action =
Urinary excretion of the test group
Urinary excretion of the control group
,
(3)
Diuretic index =
Diuretic action of the test group
Diuretic action of the standard group
.
